sentence.content: Emperor Hirohito left $13.06 million in taxable property, a tax office near the Imperial Palace announced Monday.

sentence.content: The Japanese constitution, drafted by U.S. occupation forces shortly after the end of World War II in 1945, stipulates the emperor is the ``symbol of the state and the unity of the people.&apost;&apost;

sentence.content: Three sacred treasures _ a mirror, sword and jewels _ which were transferred from emperor to emperor, were tax-exempt, as were about 3,180 items of art owned by Hirohito that were donated to the state, the tax office official said.
